rev.comment: This is a jokey column by an individual, not an official recognition from Time.
rev.diff:
Line 166: Line 166:
<ref name=usatoday>{{cite web |accessdate=2010-03-25 |url=http://www.usatoday.com/money/2005-09-22-forbes_x.htm |title=Gates still the richest, but Google guys moving up |work=USA Today |date=2005-09-22 }}</ref> They each lost $1 billion in wealth in 2006 when Google performed a stock sell-off.
<ref name=usatoday>{{cite web |accessdate=2010-03-25 |url=http://www.usatoday.com/money/2005-09-22-forbes_x.htm |title=Gates still the richest, but Google guys moving up |work=USA Today |date=2005-09-22 }}</ref> They each lost $1 billion in wealth in 2006 when Google performed a stock sell-off.
<ref name=nypost>{{cite news |title=Bad Day at Work |work=New York Post |date=2006-02-02 |author=Gustin, Sam }}</ref> The two typically diversify their net worth outside of the company. From 2004 to 2006, they each sold about 7.2 million Google shares as part of an 18-month diversification plan, giving them each $1.22 billion, making them billionaires in terms of real money rather than in shares only. After the sale, the Google Guys each still held 81.1% of their <!--original? post-IPO?--> stock holdings. Together with company CEO Schmidt, they now hold 27% of Google's [[outstanding shares]], and 40.4% of the voting power.<ref name=sbeat>{{cite web |accessdate=2010-03-25 |url=http://www.siliconbeat.com/entries/2004/11/19/google_guys_billionaires_at_last.html |title=Google Guys -- billionaires at last |work=SiliconBeat |publisher=The Mercury News |date=2004-11-19 |author=Marshal, Matt }}</ref>{{Update after}} In 2010, [[Forbes|''Forbes'' magazine]] listed both individuals as the 24th richest people in the world, with a net worth of $17.5 billion each.<ref name=forbes-2010>{{cite web |accessdate=2010-03-25 |url=http://www.forbes.com/lists/2010/10/billionaires-2010_The-Worlds-Billionaires_Rank.html |title=The World's Billionaires |work=Forbes |date=2010-03-10 }}</ref>
<ref name=nypost>{{cite news |title=Bad Day at Work |work=New York Post |date=2006-02-02 |author=Gustin, Sam }}</ref> The two typically diversify their net worth outside of the company. From 2004 to 2006, they each sold about 7.2 million Google shares as part of an 18-month diversification plan, giving them each $1.22 billion, making them billionaires in terms of real money rather than in shares only. After the sale, the Google Guys each still held 81.1% of their <!--original? post-IPO?--> stock holdings. Together with company CEO Schmidt, they now hold 27% of Google's [[outstanding shares]], and 40.4% of the voting power.<ref name=sbeat>{{cite web |accessdate=2010-03-25 |url=http://www.siliconbeat.com/entries/2004/11/19/google_guys_billionaires_at_last.html |title=Google Guys -- billionaires at last |work=SiliconBeat |publisher=The Mercury News |date=2004-11-19 |author=Marshal, Matt }}</ref>{{Update after}} In 2010, [[Forbes|''Forbes'' magazine]] listed both individuals as the 24th richest people in the world, with a net worth of $17.5 billion each.<ref name=forbes-2010>{{cite web |accessdate=2010-03-25 |url=http://www.forbes.com/lists/2010/10/billionaires-2010_The-Worlds-Billionaires_Rank.html |title=The World's Billionaires |work=Forbes |date=2010-03-10 }}</ref>
â
The two were chosen as [[ABC News]]'s "People of the Year" for 2004.<ref name=abcnews>{{cite web |accessdate=2010-03-25 |url=http://abcnews.go.com/WNT/PersonOfWeek/story?id=369015 |title=People of the Year: Google Guys |publisher=ABC News |date=2004-12-29 }}</ref> They were also jointly chosen as [[Time (magazine)|''Time'' magazine's]] "Person of the Decade" for the 2000s.
+
The two were chosen as [[ABC News]]'s "People of the Year" for 2004.<ref name=abcnews>{{cite web |accessdate=2010-03-25 |url=http://abcnews.go.com/WNT/PersonOfWeek/story?id=369015 |title=People of the Year: Google Guys |publisher=ABC News |date=2004-12-29 }}</ref>
â
<ref name=time-decade>{{cite web |accessdate=2010-03-25 |url=http://www.time.com/time/world/article/0,8599,1948170,00.html?iid=tsmodule |title=And the Decade Goes To ... |work=Time |date=2009-12-17 |author=Stein, Joel }}</ref>
